comments:
Not sure how it happend, happend on its own shortly after starting...  

Stacktrace below, and shows why you should *not* do a whole lot in the plugins startup method, delegate to a job if at all possible...

(In reply to comment #0)
> Not sure how it happend, happend on its own shortly after starting...  
> 
> Stacktrace below, and shows why you should *not* do a whole lot in the plugins
> startup method, delegate to a job if at all possible...

The implementation intention was to try to initiate the resource change handling right from the start() and in case of a fail - delegate this to the job.
The code did not handle the case when the error is thrown.
I?ve changed the code to catch Throwable instead of  Exception.

The bug should be fixed now. Please re-open if you have any objections/comments.

Thanks,
Mikhail
If you are capable of performing this in job, why not always do that, it would seem to me that this would allow for faster loading of the plug-in.

The reason why we try to do that from the start() is because we have to perform some adjustments before the build information is loaded.
If we don?t do that before the managed build info is returned to the caller, the build info might be invalid. We don?t have a guarantee that the build information adjustment will be performed on time when we do it from the scheduled job.
That is why we try to perform the adjustments immediately from the start() and if that fails - schedule a job.

Mikhail

I have made a change to always schedule a job for the resource change handling initialization. Doing it directly from the Plugin.start() might result in throwing an error (see the stack trace in the bug description). The Error JavaDoc says: * An Error is a subclass of Throwable * that indicates serious problems that a reasonable application * should not try to catch... As I understand this, in case of an Error, we might not be able to recover, so we should avoid it. So as was suggested by David, resource change handling initialization is always performed from the job now. Closing the bug.. Please reopen if needed. Thanks, Mikhail
